chinese: 1) the gradual change and development of an idea, situation, or object 演变；逐步发展
examples: e.g. [[Evolution]] of language is the gradual change in human language over time.；e.g. The emergence of language was a defining moment in the [[evolution]] of modern humans.

chinese: 2) the scientific idea that plants and animals develop and change gradually over a long period of time 进化（论）
examples: e.g. [[Evolution]] of language is the gradual change in human language over time.；e.g. The emergence of language was a defining moment in the [[evolution]] of modern humans.

chinese: [U] 网络语言
[U] very informal words and expressions that are more common in spoken language, esp. used by a particular group of people, e.g. children, soldiers 俚语
examples: e.g. These are some [[slang]] words teens might use when talking about other people.

chinese: [C] a short form of a word or expression 缩略语，缩写 （形式）
examples: e.g. The styling of [[abbreviations]] is inconsistent and includes many possible variations.

chinese: make sth. bigger or looser by pulling it, or become bigger or looser as a result of being pulled （使）变大；（使）变松；拉长
examples: e.g. A spider's web can [[stretch]] considerably without weakening.

chinese: [U] 众筹（向大众募集资金的做法，常在因特网上进行）
[C] (infml.) 自拍照片
[U] the activity of sending Internet or text messages that threaten or insult sb. 网络霸凌（欺凌）
examples: e.g. The school provides guidance for parents on how to deal with issues such as [[cyberbullying]].

chinese: (fml.) (only before noun) existing before a particular time or event 先于···存在的
examples: e.g. But, this research doesn't consider the effects of [[pre-existing]] relationships.

chinese: 1) [U] when you become involved with sb. / sth. in order to understand them 密切关系
examples: e.g. Virtual employee [[engagement]] activities are ways to improve the relationship between an organization and its remote workers.；e.g. The man knew about the [[engagement]] and brought them a bottle of champagne as a gift.

chinese: 2) [C] an agreement between two people to marry, or the period of time they are engaged 婚约；订婚期间
examples: e.g. Virtual employee [[engagement]] activities are ways to improve the relationship between an organization and its remote workers.；e.g. The man knew about the [[engagement]] and brought them a bottle of champagne as a gift.

chinese: if a process accelerates or if sth. accelerates it, it happens faster than usual or sooner than you expect （使）加快；（使）加速
examples: e.g. More efforts will be made in the years ahead to [[accelerate]] the agricultural reform.

chinese: [sing.] the vocabulary of a person, language, or branch of knowledge（个人、语言或学科的）词汇
examples: e.g. The word "cloud" is attached to many terms in the computing [[lexicon]].

chinese: (ta-ta for now) (BrE, infml.) used in emails and text messages to say goodbye to sb. 回头见（用于电子邮件和手机短信中）
examples: e.g. Anyway, [[TTFN]], and hopefully I'll have plenty of time to write when I get back.

chinese: 1) find the origins of when sth. began or where it came from 追溯；追查
examples: e.g. The style of these paintings can be [[traced]] back to early medieval influences.；e.g. Police are trying to [[trace]] a young woman who was seen near the accident.

chinese: 2) find sb. / sth. that has disappeared by searching for them carefully 仔细找寻
examples: e.g. The style of these paintings can be [[traced]] back to early medieval influences.；e.g. Police are trying to [[trace]] a young woman who was seen near the accident.

chinese: (also d'oh) (spoken) used humorously when you have just realized that you have done or said sth. stupid 噢，呀（幽默用法，意识到自己做错事或说错话时发出的感叹语）
examples: e.g. "[[Doh]]! That was the biggest mistake in my career," said Jack.

chinese: [C] a book or list of names, facts, etc., usu. arranged in alphabetical order （通常按字母顺序排列的）姓名地址录，名录，电话簿
examples: e.g. I couldn't find your number in the telephone [[directory]].

chinese: [U] help or support 帮助；援助
examples: e.g. The work was completed with the [[assistance]] of local carpenters.

chinese: 1) make the difference between two ideas, subjects, etc. less clear （使）（想法、主题等）难以区分，模糊
examples: e.g. She tends to [[blur]] the distinction between her friends and her colleagues.；e.g. The writing [[blurred]] and danced before his eyes.

chinese: 2) become difficult to see, or make sth. difficult to see, because the edges are not clear （使）（某物）模糊不清
examples: e.g. She tends to [[blur]] the distinction between her friends and her colleagues.；e.g. The writing [[blurred]] and danced before his eyes.

chinese: [C, U] a clear difference or separation between two similar things 差别；区别；差异
examples: e.g. We need to draw a [[distinction]] between the two events, even though they are both related to financial issues.

chinese: common at a particular time, in a particular place, or among a particular group of people 普遍的；盛行的；流行的
examples: e.g. One [[prevalent]] quality we have found in teens' statements about themselves is a strikingly positive emotional tone.

chinese: [U] the study of language in general and of particular languages, their structure, grammar, and history 语言学
examples: e.g. As a specialist in [[linguistics]], I have studied how the conversational styles of men and women differ.

chinese: [C] a word formed from the initial letters of other words 首字母缩略词
examples: e.g. More typically, [[acronyms]] are pronounced as new single words, as in UNESCO.

chinese: (laughing out loud) used in emails, text messages, etc. to show that you think sth. is funny 大声笑（用于电子邮件、手机短信等中表示认为某事很好笑）
examples: e.g. The dog kept running around chasing its tail. [[LOL]].

chinese: 1) the amount of time that sth. lasts 持续时间
examples: e.g. By offering services to help expand the [[longevity]] of their products, they are promising quality and durability to consumers.；e.g. The new study appears to be the first to specifically look at the relationship between optimism and [[longevity]].

chinese: 2) the amount of time that sb. / sth. lives 寿命
examples: e.g. By offering services to help expand the [[longevity]] of their products, they are promising quality and durability to consumers.；e.g. The new study appears to be the first to specifically look at the relationship between optimism and [[longevity]].

chinese: having the right to do or obtain sth. 合格的；有资格的
examples: e.g. If you are a teenager living in certain parts of the province, you could be [[eligible]] for this program.

chinese: 1) (fml.) consider or discuss sth. again 重新考虑；再次讨论
examples: e.g. We need to [[revisit]] this proposal as soon as the budget is clearer.；e.g. Ten years later, I [[revisited]] the school to find out what had changed.

chinese: 2) (written) return to a place you once knew well 重游；再访
examples: e.g. We need to [[revisit]] this proposal as soon as the budget is clearer.；e.g. Ten years later, I [[revisited]] the school to find out what had changed.

chinese: 1) [U] the way in which sth. is used, or the amount of it that is used 使用方法；使用量
examples: e.g. It involves changing product quality, features, or style to attract new users or more [[usage]] from present users.；e.g. The dictionary focuses on the more usual words of the language and avoids rare [[usages]] of these words.

chinese: 2) [C, U] the way that words are used in a language （词语的）用法
examples: e.g. It involves changing product quality, features, or style to attract new users or more [[usage]] from present users.；e.g. The dictionary focuses on the more usual words of the language and avoids rare [[usages]] of these words.

chinese: (only before noun) accepted by or involving most people in a society 主流的；主要的
examples: e.g. Our survey is intended to find out which [[mainstream]] car has the most appeal for both private and business buyers on a budget.；e.g. Environmental ideas have been absorbed into the [[mainstream]] of our politics.

chinese: [sing.] (the ~) the most usual ideas or methods, or the people who have these ideas or methods （思想或方法的）主流；主流群体
examples: e.g. Our survey is intended to find out which [[mainstream]] car has the most appeal for both private and business buyers on a budget.；e.g. Environmental ideas have been absorbed into the [[mainstream]] of our politics.

chinese: 1) unclear or confused 糊涂的；不明确的
examples: e.g. There's a [[fuzzy]] line between parents' and schools' responsibilities.；e.g. Some of the photos were so [[fuzzy]] that it was hard to tell who was who.

chinese: 2) not clear in shape or sound（形状或声音）模糊的
examples: e.g. There's a [[fuzzy]] line between parents' and schools' responsibilities.；e.g. Some of the photos were so [[fuzzy]] that it was hard to tell who was who.

chinese: 1) [sing.] when sth. new begins to exist or starts being used 首次出现（使用）；问世
examples: e.g. The industry has changed greatly with the [[appearance]] of new technologies.；e.g. We are often attracted to somebody first by their physical [[appearance]].

chinese: 2) [C, U] the way sb. / sth. looks to other people 外表；外观
examples: e.g. The industry has changed greatly with the [[appearance]] of new technologies.；e.g. We are often attracted to somebody first by their physical [[appearance]].

chinese: [U] words and expressions used in a particular profession or by a particular group of people, which are difficult for other people to understand — often used to show disapproval （难懂的）行话，术语（常含贬义）
examples: e.g. I'm going to explain it without [[jargon]], and without making it unnecessarily complicated and complex.

chinese: not appearing to be affected by the process of time passing or by changes in fashion 不受时间影响的；永不过时的
examples: e.g. Lu Xun, an influential Chinese writer, essayist, and translator, produced that [[timeless]] classic, and many more.

chinese: 1) force sb. to have the same ideas, beliefs, etc. as you 将（想法、信仰等）强加（于某人）
examples: e.g. I can't understand why she always tries to [[impose]] her own ideas on the rest of the team.；e.g. The court has the power to [[impose]] an unlimited fine for this offence.

chinese: 2) if sb. in authority imposes a rule, punishment, tax, etc., they force people to accept it 强制推行；强制实行
examples: e.g. I can't understand why she always tries to [[impose]] her own ideas on the rest of the team.；e.g. The court has the power to [[impose]] an unlimited fine for this offence.

chinese: (~s) [pl.] the things that you do not like 不喜欢的东西
examples: e.g. A good hotel manager should know his regular guests' likes and [[dislikes]].；e.g. He simply [[disliked]] working with committees and avoided it whenever possible.

chinese: think sb. / sth. is unpleasant and not like them 不喜欢；讨厌
examples: e.g. A good hotel manager should know his regular guests' likes and [[dislikes]].；e.g. He simply [[disliked]] working with committees and avoided it whenever possible.

chinese: (fml.) making you anxious 令人焦虑的
examples: e.g. The scientists report that some of the signs they have found are [[worrisome]].

chinese: extremely interesting 迷人的；非常有趣的
examples: e.g. With the accompaniment of the piano, the poems sounded [[fascinating]] and became really popular.

chinese: (remade, remade) make sth. again, esp. in a different way（尤指以不同的方式）重新制作
examples: e.g. The mall has been moving aggressively to try to [[remake]] itself for a new era of shopping.

chinese: if one has had their fair share of sth., e.g. problems, success, or adventure, a lot of it has happened to them（问题，成功或冒险经历等）相当多的
examples: e.g. He'd had more than his fair share of adventure.

chinese: be present for a short time and then go away 断断续续；时来时去
examples: e.g. The pain in my leg [[comes]] and [[goes]].

chinese: move or happen faster, or make sth. move or happen faster （使）加快速度
examples: e.g. The world's clock has [[sped up]] as nations around the globe are reinventing themselves at a faster and faster pace.

chinese: through / by oral communication 口口相传
examples: e.g. Much of this information is picked up by word of mouth from previous students.

chinese: (infml.) remain in or near a place 待在某地；待在附近
examples: e.g. "Without hesitation, she replied, "I don't know. Let's [[stick around]] and find out."

chinese: manage to do as much or as well as other people 跟上；保持同步
examples: e.g. He found it difficult to [[keep up with]] the rest of the class.

chinese: 班戈大学（英国大学，位于威尔士）
